sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with complex coefficients
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations with complex coefficients:

x + 2y + 3z = 4 + 2i

2x - y - 4z = -1 + 3i

3x + 5y + 2z = 5 - i
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations with complex coefficients, we can use the Gaussian elimination method.

First, we write the augmented matrix for the system:

```
| 1  2  3 | 4 + 2i |
| 2 -1 -4 | -1 + 3i|
| 3  5  2 | 5 - i  |
```

Step 1: Eliminate the first element in the second and third rows.

R2 = R2 - 2*R1
R3 = R3 - 3*R1

```
| 1  2   3  |  4 + 2i  |
| 0 -5  -10 | -9 + i   |
| 0 -1  -7  | -7 - 7i  |
```

Step 2: Swap R2 and R3.

```
| 1  2   3  |  4 + 2i  |
| 0 -1  -7  | -7 - 7i  |
| 0 -5  -10 | -9 + i   |
```

Step 3: Eliminate the second element in the third row.

R3 = R3 - 5*R2

```
| 1  2   3  |  4 + 2i  |
| 0 -1  -7  | -7 - 7i  |
| 0  0   25 |  20 - 36i|
```

Step 4: Solve for z.

z = (20 - 36i) / 25
z = (4/5) - (36/25)i

Step 5: Solve for y.

y = -7z - 7 - 7i
y = -7((4/5) - (36/25)i) - 7 - 7i
y = (3/5) + (19/5)i

Step 6: Solve for x.

x = 4 + 2i - 2y - 3z
x = 4 + 2i - 2((3/5) + (19/5)i) - 3((4/5) - (36/25)i)
x = 1 - (2/5)i

The solution for the system of linear equations with complex coefficients is:

x = 1 - (2/5)i
y = (3/5) + (19/5)i
z = (4/5) - (36/25)i
